errors.simple: You're using a variable that doesn't exist or hasn't been declared yet.
errors.fix:
Check:
• Did you declare the variable with let/const/var?
• Is it spelled correctly?
• Are you trying to use it before declaring it?
• Is it in scope?

errors.simple: You're trying to use something in the wrong way.
errors.fix:
Common causes:
• Calling something that's not a function
• Accessing property of null/undefined
• Wrong data type
• Check if object exists before using it

errors.simple: There's a syntax mistake in your code.
errors.fix:
Look for:
• Missing closing brackets ) ] }
• Missing commas in objects/arrays
• Missing quotes around strings
• Using reserved keywords incorrectly

Check for:
• Infinite recursion (function calling itself)
• Creating arrays that are too large
• Add base case to recursive functions

errors.simple: The URL or URI you're trying to encode/decode is invalid.
errors.fix:
Make sure:
• URL is properly formatted
• Special characters are encoded
• Use encodeURIComponent() for URL parts
